required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose-finding Study Comparing Efficacy and Safety of a PARP Inhibitor Against Doxil in BRCA+ve Advanced Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Open-Label, Randomised, Comparative, International Multicentre Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Different Doses of AZD2281 Given Orally Twice Daily Versus Intravenous Liposomal Doxorubicin Given Monthly in Patients With Advanced BRCA1- or BRCA2-Associated Ovarian Cancer Who Have Failed Previous Platinum-based Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the efficacy and safety of 2 doses of drug AZD2281 against liposomal doxorubicin to see which is effective and well tolerated in treating patients with measurable BRCA1- or BRCA2-positive advanced ovarian cancer and who have failed previous platinum therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) (According to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours [RECIST])
primary_outcome.time_frame: Tumour assessment was to be assessed at screening, every 8 weeks during the study and at the withdrawal visit, up to 56 weeks. (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time to progression from the date of randomisation until the date of radiological assessment of progression per RECIST criteria or death (by any cause in the absence of progression)

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) (According to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours - RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR was defined according to RECIST. Complete response (CR) or partial response - (PR)- 30% decrease Patients with a best RECIST response of CR or PR had to have a confirmed response at least 28 days later.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of response was defined as time (months) from initial assessment of PR/CR until earliest date of objective progression or death. (Values may be underestimated as some patients had not progressed at final analysis so true duration is likely to be greater than that in database.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Percentage Change in Tumour Size
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage change (reduction) from baseline in the sum of the lengths of the longest diameter (LD) of the RECIST target lesions were objectively documented, regardless of whether the patient was still taking study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Percentage Change From Baseline in CA-125 Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: Best percentage change in cancer antigen 125 (CA-125) levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Confirmed RECIST Response and/or CA-125 Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients reporting a RECIST confirmed response and/or a CA-125 response (in the absence of progression). A CA-125 response was defined as a confirmed greater or equal to 50% reduction in CA-125.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients with confirmed CR (disappearance of all target lesions) or PR (30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions ) or SD ( small changes ) >4 months, divided by the number of randomised patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of the cut-off for the final analysis of overall survival (30 April 2010)
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as time from randomisation to date of death from any cause. Patients who had not died at time of analysis were censored at last date they were known to be alive. Median OS was not calculable for olaparib groups due to an insufficient number of deaths so the percentage of participants who died are shown along with 95% confidence intervals

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Quality of Life (QoL) Response for Trial Outcome Index (TOI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: Best HRQoL response using the TOI endpoint. Improvement was defined as a change from baseline of greater than or equal to +7. The TOI score ranges from 0-100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best QoL Response for Total Functional Analysis of Cancer Therapy - Ovarian (FACT-O)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: Best HRQoL response using the total FACT-O endpoint. Improvement was defined as a change from baseline of greater than or equal to +9.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best QoL Response for FACT-O Symptom Index (FOSI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)
secondary_outcome.description: Best HRQoL response using the FOSI endpoint. Improvement was defined as a change from baseline of greater than or equal to +3.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced ovarian cancer with positive BRCA1 or BRCA2 status
- Progressive or recurrent disease after platinum-based chemotherapy
- Measurable disease by RECIST
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous anthracycline treatment
- Brain metastases
- Less than 28 days since last treatment used to treat the disease
- Considered a poor medical risk due to a serious uncontrolled disorder

overall_official.last_name: Stan Kaye, BSc, MB, FRCP, FRCR, SMedSCi

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The first patient was enrolled on 30 July 2008 and the last patient was enrolled on 3 March 2009 (for initial treatment). Patients were enrolled at 25 centres in 9 countries: Australia, Belgium, Germany, Israel, Poland, Spain, Sweden, UK and USA.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One hundred and twenty-five (125) women with advanced breast cancer gene (BRCA) 1- or 2- associated ovarian cancer who had failed previous platinum-based chemotherapy were planned to receive olaparib 200 mg bd, olaparib 400 mg bd or liposomal doxorubicin 50 mg/m2 intravenously in a 1:1:1 ratio. Of these 97 were randomised.

group.title: Olaparib 200 mg bd
group.description: Olaparib (AZD2281) 200 mg oral capsules twice daily

group.title: Olaparib 400 mg bd
group.description: Olaparib (AZD2281) 400 mg oral capsules twice daily

group.title: Liposomal Doxorubicin
group.description: Liposomal doxorubicin 50 mg/m2 intravenously every 4 weeks

participants_list.participants: Patients who received olaparib (crossed over). 1 of 33 did not receive Liposomal Doxorubicin.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not receive cross over treatment

participants_list.participants: Patients who crossed over from Liposomal doxorubicin to Olaparib 400 mg bd

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) (According to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours [RECIST])
measure.description: PFS was defined as the time to progression from the date of randomisation until the date of radiological assessment of progression per RECIST criteria or death (by any cause in the absence of progression)

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of olaparib 200 or 400 mg bd (n=64) versus liposomal doxorubicin (n=33). A hazard ratio < 1 favours olaparib.
analysis.p_value_desc: If the observed p-value for the combined olaparib groups is <0.02 (1-sided) then the result will be regarded as statistically significant.
analysis.method_desc: Cox proportional hazards model with factors for treatment, BRCA (1 or 2) and platinum sensitivity (sensitive=1 or resistant/refractory=0).

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of olaparib 200 (n=32) versus liposomal doxorubicin (n=33). A hazard ratio < 1 favours olaparib.
analysis.p_value_desc: An observed p-value of <0.005 (1-sided) will be regarded as statistically significant for a given pairwise comparison.
analysis.method_desc: Cox proportional hazards model with factors for treatment, BRCA (1 or 2) and platinum sensitivity (sensitive=1 or resistant/refractory=0).

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of olaparib 400 (n=32) versus liposomal doxorubicin (n=33). A hazard ratio < 1 favours olaparib.
analysis.p_value_desc: An observed p-value of <0.005 (1-sided) will be regarded as statistically significant for a given pairwise comparison.
analysis.method_desc: Cox proportional hazards model with factors for treatment, BRCA (1 or 2) and platinum sensitivity (sensitive=1 or resistant/refractory=0).

outcome.description: ORR was defined according to RECIST. Complete response (CR) or partial response - (PR)- 30% decrease Patients with a best RECIST response of CR or PR had to have a confirmed response at least 28 days later.
outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)

outcome.population: Duration of response is analysed for patients experiencing a response.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS was defined as time from randomisation to date of death from any cause. Patients who had not died at time of analysis were censored at last date they were known to be alive. Median OS was not calculable for olaparib groups due to an insufficient number of deaths so the percentage of participants who died are shown along with 95% confidence intervals
outcome.time_frame: At the time of the cut-off for the final analysis of overall survival (30 April 2010)

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of olaparib 200 or 400 (n=64) versus liposomal doxorubicin (n=33).
analysis.method_desc: Analysis was performed using a Cox proportional hazards model with factors for treatment, BRCA status and platinum sensitivity.
analysis.estimate_desc: A hazard ratio of <1 favoured olaparib.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of olaparib 200 (n=32) versus liposomal doxorubicin (n=33).
analysis.method_desc: Analysis was performed using a Cox proportional hazards model with factors for treatment, BRCA status and platinum sensitivity.
analysis.estimate_desc: A hazard ratio of <1 favoured olaparib.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of olaparib 400 (n=32) versus liposomal doxorubicin (n=33).
analysis.method_desc: Analysis was performed using a Cox proportional hazards model with factors for treatment, BRCA status and platinum sensitivity.
analysis.estimate_desc: A hazard ratio of <1 favoured olaparib.

outcome.title: Best Quality of Life (QoL) Response for Trial Outcome Index (TOI)
outcome.description: Best HRQoL response using the TOI endpoint. Improvement was defined as a change from baseline of greater than or equal to +7. The TOI score ranges from 0-100.
outcome.time_frame: At the time that 57 PFS events had occurred (Data cut-off for primary analysis of PFS: 15 September 2009)

reported_events.desc: AEs reported = all events up to OS data cut-off. After PFS data cut-off, AEs only collected for olaparib and cross-over groups. The safety profile of these 2 groups at OS was consistent with that at time of PFS. One patient was recorded as crossing over to olaparib but not receiving cross-over treatment.

group.title: Olaparib 200 mg bd
group.description: Olaparib (AZD2281) 200 mg oral capsules twice daily

group.title: Olaparib 400 mg bd
group.description: Olaparib (AZD2281) 400 mg oral capsules twice daily

group.title: Liposomal Doxorubicin
group.description: Liposomal doxorubicin 50 mg/m2 intravenously every 4 weeks

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: No publication of the study results may be made until publication of the results of the multi-centre study or 2 years after study completion, whichever is the sooner

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The AEs reported include all events up to the OS data cut-off. After the PFS data cut-off, AEs were only collected for the olaparib and cross-over groups. The safety profile of these 2 groups at OS was consistent with that at the time of PFS.
